required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Monotherapy in Subjects With Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Study of the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics Profiles and Preliminary Efficacy of 3D185 Monotherapy in Subjects With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase 1 Study of the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics Profiles, and Preliminary Efficacy of 3D185 Monotherapy in Subjects with Advanced Solid Tumors

detailed_description.textblock:
Subjects with advanced solid tumors who have no available standard therapy or who have failed standard therapies.
This is an open-label, global multicenter, dose-escalation phase 1 study of safety, tolerability, preliminary PK profile, and preliminary efficacy of 3D185 capsules monotherapy in subjects with advanced solid tumors.
The starting dose in this dose-escalation study is 50 mg, and the preset 6 dose-escalation cohorts are 50 mg, 100 mg, 150 mg, 200 mg, 250 mg, and 300 mg, respectively.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: sequential assignment The starting dose in this dose-escalation study is 50 mg, and the preset 6 dose-escalation cohorts are 50 mg, 100 mg, 150 mg, 200 mg, 250 mg, and 300 mg, respectively.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety Evaluation: frequency and severity of AEs
primary_outcome.description: Evaluated based on the frequency and severity of AEs according to NCI CTCAE v4.03.

primary_outcome.measure: Tolerability Evaluation: frequency and severity of AEs
primary_outcome.description: based on the frequency and severity of AEs according to NCI CTCAE v4.03.

secondary_outcome.description: Per RECIST version 1.1 criteria in Solid tumors v 1.1 (RECIST) assessed by investigator

The test of PK samples will be performed by central laboratory. The PK parameters will be calculated using standard non-compartment models and WinNonlin® Professional 6.4 or higher version (Certara, Princeton, NJ, USA) or SAS® 9.3 or higher version (SAS Institute, Inc., Cary, North Carolina) to fully reflect the drug absorption, distribution and elimination characteristics in the human body. The interim PK parameters will be calculated using the planned blood collection time, and the final PK parameters will be calculated using the actual blood collection time.

The test of PK samples will be performed by central laboratory. The PK parameters will be calculated using standard non-compartment models and WinNonlin® Professional 6.4 or higher version (Certara, Princeton, NJ, USA) or SAS® 9.3 or higher version (SAS Institute, Inc., Cary, North Carolina) to fully reflect the drug absorption, distribution and elimination characteristics in the human body. The interim PK parameters will be calculated using the planned blood collection time, and the final PK parameters will be calculated using the actual blood collection time.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK evaluation: AUC0-24 h, AUC0-96 h, AUC0-∞,

arm_group.description: The starting dose in this dose-escalation study is 50 mg, and the preset 6 dose-escalation cohorts are 50 mg, 100 mg, 150 mg, 200 mg, 250 mg, and 300 mg, respectively. This study adopts an i3+3 method for dose escalation. All subjects in each cohort will receive a single oral dose of 3D185, followed by a 7-day washout period (i.e. single-dose PK study period). Then, subjects will receive consecutive daily doses (Once daily [QD], 28 days/cycle) until disease progression, death, unacceptable toxicity, or withdraw of informed consent, whichever comes first

intervention.description: All subjects in each cohort will receive a single oral dose of 3D185, followed by a 7-day washout period (i.e. single-dose PK study period). Then, subjects will receive consecutive daily doses (Once daily [QD], 28 days/cycle) until disease progression, death, unacceptable toxicity, or withdraw of informed consent, whichever comes first. The dose limiting toxicity (DLT) evaluation period includes the single-dose PK study period and the first treatment cycle (within 35 days after the first dose). The enrolled subjects will be sequentially assigned to the planned dose cohorts according to the protocol and receive 3D185 treatment to observe the occurrence of DLT.
